member.name: F:DotNetNuke.Web.Client.FileOrder.Js.DefaultPriority
member.summary: The default priority (100) indicates that the ordering will be done based on the order in which the registrations are made

member.name: F:DotNetNuke.Web.Client.FileOrder.Js.jQuery
member.summary: jQuery (CDN or local file) has the priority of 5

member.summary: jQuery Migrate file has the priority of 6, it should appear just after jquery.

member.name: F:DotNetNuke.Web.Client.FileOrder.Js.DnnDomPositioning
member.summary: /js/dnn.dom.positioning.js has the priority of 35

member.name: F:DotNetNuke.Web.Client.FileOrder.Js.DnnControls
member.summary: /js/dnn.controls.js has the priority of 40

member.summary: Resources CSS files have a priority of 12

member.summary: Skin CSS files have a priority of 15

member.name: F:DotNetNuke.Web.Client.ClientResourceSettings.UpgradeStatus.Unknown

member.summary: The name of the placeholder in which the controls will be rendered

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.Web.Client.Providers.DnnPageHeaderProvider.RegisterDependencies(System.Web.HttpContextBase,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Registers the dependencies in the body of default.aspx
member.remarks: For some reason ampersands that aren't html escaped are not compliant to HTML standards when they exist in 'link' or 'script' tags in URLs, we need to replace the ampersands with & . This is only required for this one w3c compliancy, the URL itself is a valid URL.

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.Web.Client.Providers.DnnBodyProvider.Initialize(System.String,System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection)
member.summary: Initializes the provider.
member.param: The friendly name of the provider.
A collection of the name/value pairs representing the provider-specific attributes specified in the configuration for this provider.
member.exception: The name of the provider is null.
The name of the provider has a length of zero.
An attempt is made to call on a provider after the provider has already been initialized.

member.name: M:DotNetNuke.Web.Client.Providers.DnnBodyProvider.RegisterDependencies(System.Web.HttpContextBase,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Registers the dependencies in the body of default.aspx
member.remarks: For some reason ampersands that aren't html escaped are not compliant to HTML standards when they exist in 'link' or 'script' tags in URLs, we need to replace the ampersands with & . This is only required for this one w3c compliancy, the URL itself is a valid URL.
